AF.content: ghost can see you, you can’t see ghost
AF.linkedContent: ghost can see you, you can’t see ghost

SPOM.content: what spirit & specter have in common, one doesn’t know if it exists, doesn’t belong to knowledge, almost unnameable thing qui nous regarde
SPOM.linkedContent: what spirit & specter have in common, one doesn’t know if it exists, doesn’t belong to knowledge, almost unnameable thing qui nous regarde

SPOM.content: visor effect linked to everything we will say about specter in general > such is the difference btwn le spectre ou le revenant de l’esprit, fut-ce de l’esprit au sense de fantôme en general > supernatural, paradoxical phenomenology, ungraspable visibility of the invisible, the non-sensuous sensuous of Capital, intangibility of a proper body w/out flesh [see p. 156 are specter/ghost different?]
SPOM.linkedContent: visor effect linked to everything we will say about specter in general > such is the difference btwn le spectre ou le revenant de l’esprit, fut-ce de l’esprit au sense de fantôme en general > supernatural, paradoxical phenomenology, ungraspable visibility of the invisible, the non-sensuous sensuous of Capital, intangibility of a proper body w/out flesh [see p. 156 are specter/ghost different?]

SPOM.content: spectral interrupts all specularity, de-synchronizes, calls us to anachrony: we do not see who looks at us
SPOM.linkedContent: spectral interrupts all specularity, de-synchronizes, calls us to anachrony: we do not see who looks at us

SPOM.content: visor effect: “to feel ourselves seen by a look which it will always be impossible to cross” > the inheritance of law
SPOM.linkedContent: visor effect: “to feel ourselves seen by a look which it will always be impossible to cross” > the inheritance of law

SPOM.content: both mask and helmet share the (supreme sign of) power: looking w/out being seen
SPOM.linkedContent: both mask and helmet share the (supreme sign of) power: looking w/out being seen

SPOM.content: specter first of all sees us
figures of the ghost first of all faces, matter of masks, helmet, visor
SPOM.linkedContent: figures of the ghost first of all faces, matter of masks, helmet, visor

SPOM.content: Marx’s theory of ideology: the “second” ghost > incorporation of autonomized spirit [“first” ghost?], ideological (fetish) lent a borrowed body [see DEBT], second incarnation “conferred on an initial idealization,” a non-natural body, a technical body or an institutional body (helmet of ideologem or fetish under armor)
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx’s theory of ideology: the “second” ghost > incorporation of autonomized spirit [“first” ghost?], ideological (fetish) lent a borrowed body [see DEBT], second incarnation “conferred on an initial idealization,” a non-natural body, a technical body or an institutional body (helmet of ideologem or fetish under armor)

BSi.content: the wolf looms, fabulous animal, a fantasma in sense of revenant, wolf more terrifying when not there, a metonymic substitute come to announce/conceal, to manifest/mask

BSi.content: a loup [party mask], feminine visor-effect: see w/out being seen

BSi.content: visor-effect: king sees w/out [his gaze, origin of his seeing, his eyes] being seen

BSi.content: [during spectacle of autopsy/sovereignty] an éclat > fragment of light touches everything
